result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin T. Martine

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

9:46 AM cases 22CF1029, 22CF742 called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Justin T. Martine in court with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson.

22CF1029 Initial Appearance: Defense waives reading of the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. Bond is set. 

22CF742: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court accepts the pleas.

Branch 1 for further scheduling. New 22CF1029 is to ride along.
